topics.title: Introduction
points: Cloud computing delivers computing services over the internet
Pay-as-you-go model for resources and services
No need to manage infrastructure yourself
Focus on business logic instead of infrastructure

topics.title: Cloud Service Models
topics.description: Different levels of cloud service offerings
points: IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service): Virtual machines, storage, networking
PaaS (Platform as a Service): Development and deployment platform
SaaS (Software as a Service): Complete software applications
FaaS (Function as a Service): Serverless computing functions
DBaaS (Database as a Service): Managed database services
Each model provides different levels of abstraction
Choose based on control and management requirements

topics.title: Cloud Deployment Models
topics.description: Different ways to deploy cloud services
points: Public Cloud: Services available to general public
Private Cloud: Dedicated cloud for single organization
Hybrid Cloud: Combination of public and private clouds
Community Cloud: Shared by several organizations
Each model offers different levels of control and security
Choose based on compliance and security requirements

topics.title: AWS Services
points: EC2: Elastic Compute Cloud for virtual servers
S3: Simple Storage Service for object storage
VPC: Virtual Private Cloud for networking

topics.title: Serverless Computing
points: Examples: AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, Google Cloud Functions

topics.title: Cloud Benefits
points: Cost Reduction: No upfront infrastructure investment
Scalability: Scale up or down based on demand
Disaster Recovery: Built-in backup and recovery
Automatic Updates: Cloud provider manages updates
Focus on Business: Less time on infrastructure management

topics.title: Cloud Challenges
points: Vendor Lock-in: Dependency on specific cloud provider
Security Concerns: Data security and privacy
Internet Dependency: Requires stable internet connection
Cost Management: Unexpected costs from over-provisioning
Performance: Network latency and bandwidth limitations
Data Migration: Moving data between providers

topics.title: Cloud Security
points: Shared Responsibility Model: Provider vs customer responsibilities
Data Encryption: At rest and in transit
Network Security: VPCs, security groups, NACLs
Compliance: SOC, PCI DSS, HIPAA requirements
Backup and Recovery: Data protection strategies

topics.title: Cost Optimization
points: Right-sizing: Match resources to actual needs
Reserved Instances: Long-term commitments for discounts
Spot Instances: Use spare capacity at lower costs
Auto-scaling: Scale resources based on demand
Resource Tagging: Track costs by project/department
Cost Monitoring: Regular cost analysis and optimization
Serverless: Pay only for actual usage
Storage Optimization: Choose appropriate storage classes

topics.title: Best Practices
points: Design for failure: Build resilient systems
Implement proper backup and disaster recovery
